comments.body: While we're at it, can we update the error message for `_validate_length_limit` (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/067eea7ebb3bf9e0b0c164958eb0b619e3bf5119/mlflow/utils/validation.py#L122) to truncate the value emitted in the error message? Attempting to set a tag with a value of length 50,000 prints 50,000 characters to the console.
Displaying the first 250 characters is probably sufficient

comments.body: Note: We may eventually want to deprecate the `_validate_param_name`, `_validate_metric_name` etc helpers - they‚Äôre only needed right now to validate names on the read path for the FileStore, so we could delete them entirely if/when we deprecate the FileStore.

**nit**

"got request of size" -> "got a request of size"
